para.para: Autogenerated identifier classes and identifier objects to Themed Icons registered with .
Identifier classes should be used in attributes, XAML, or generic parameters. Where an value is expected, use the identifier object in the Id field of the identifier class.

remarks.para: This code was compile-time generated to support Themed Icons in the JetBrains application.

It has two primary goals: load the icons of this assembly to be registered with so that they were WPF-accessible and theme-sensitive; and emit early-bound accessors for referencing icons in codebehind in a compile-time-validated manner.
For performance reasons, the icons are not individually exposed with application resources. There is a custom markup extension to bind an image source in markup.
To use an icon from XAML, set an property to the markup extension, which takes an icon identifier class (nested in class) as a parameter.
Example:
Sometimes you have to reference an icon from a type attriute when you're defining objects in code. Typical examples are Options pages and Tool Windows.

To avoid the use of string IDs which are not validated very well, we've emitted identifier classes to be used with typeof() expression, one per each icon. Use the attribute overload which takes a for an image, and choose your icon class from nested classes in the class.
Example:
In codebehind, we have two distinct tasks: (a) specify some icon in the APIs and (b) render icon images onscreen.

On the APIs stage you should only manipulate icon identifier objects (of type , statically defined in in Id fields). Icon identifier classes (nested in ) should be turned into icon identifier objects as early as possible. Rendering is about getting an to assign to WPF, or to use with GDI+ / Windows Forms.

You should turn an identifier object into a rendered image as late as possible. The identifier is static and lightweight and does not depend on the current theme, while the image is themed and has to be loaded or generated/rasterized. You need an instance to get the image out of an icon identifier object. Once you got the image, you should take care to change it with theme changes â€” either by using a live image property, or by listening to the theme change event. See and its extensions for the related facilities.
Example:
remarks.code: // Getting IconId identifier object to use with APIs IconId iconid = IdeThemedIcons.ExportHtml.Id;
// Getting IconId out of an Icon Identifier Class type IconId iconid = CompiledIconClassAttribute.TryGetCompiledIconClassId(typeof(IdeThemedIcons.ExportHtml), OnError.Throw);
// Getting image for screen rendering by IconId themediconmanager.Icons[icnoid]
// Getting image for screen rendering by Icon Identifier Class themediconmanager.GetIcon<IdeThemedIcons.ExportHtml>()
remarks.para: This code was generated by a pre-compile build task from a set of input files which are XAML files adhering to a certain convention, as convenient for exporting them from the Illustrator workspace, plus separate PNG files with raster icons. In the projects, these files are designated with ThemedIconsXamlV3 and ThemedIconPng build actions and do not themselves get into the output assembly. All of such files are processed, vector images for different themes of the same icon are split and combined into the single list of icons in this assembly. This list is then written into the genearted XAML file (compiled into BAML within assembly), and serves as the source for this generated code.

remarks.para: For details on Themed Icons and their use, see Remarks on class.

example.code: IconId iconid = IdeThemedIcons.ExportHtml.Id; // IconId identifier object

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession
member.summary: The data object for the Solution Builder build session.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.BuildEventsNonProject
member.summary: Build events for the session (errors, warnings, console output, and status messages from the engine) that do not fall into any of the projects. The success/failure state of the whole build session is derived from presense of any errors messages in these events and the events of all the projects.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.BuildSeverity
member.summary: How severe should the rebuild be.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.Dispatcher
member.summary: Identifies the main thread. All of the non-constant access should occur on this thread.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.Projects
member.summary: The list of projects known to this session, in various build states. Initially empty, filled with project when the build gets .

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.State
member.summary: Build session state.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.#ctor(JetBrains.Util.FileSystemPath,JetBrains.ProjectModel.ISolution,JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget,JetBrains.Util.FileSystemPath[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Ctor.
member.param: URI of the solution file to be built.
How severe should the build be.
The projects that must be built (when we build up to them, we might stop). Empty to build the full set of projects.
Name of the solution configuration. Project configurations are taken from the configuration manager that maps solution-wide configs to per-project configs.
Name of the solution platform. Project platforms are taken from the configuration manager that maps solution-wide platforms to per-project platforms.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession.IsSilent
member.summary: Then session is silent, we don't show ui - progress in task, dashboard and build results.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.CreateBuildEventsAddRemove(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession,JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime)
member.summary: A composite signal that fires whenever a build event is added to session events or to any of the projects in the session. A new instance is created each time you call the method.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.CreateProjectErrorStatus(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject,JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime)
member.summary: Creates a property that accumulates the project error status from the project's build events. A new property and new event watcher is created each time you call the method.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.CreateProjectFullPathCache(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession)
member.summary: Creates a cache for getting the build setting project by its full path (cache throws if the element is missing). Note: every time you call this method, a NEW cache is created, whose lifetime is as long as 's.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.CreateProjectFullPathCache2(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession,JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime)
member.summary: Creates a cache for getting the build setting project by its full path. The cache is live, ie when new projects are added to the session, they also get into the cache. Note: every time you call this method, a NEW cache is created, whose lifetime is as long as 's. Dispose of the cache to break the connection.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.CreateSessionErrorStatus(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession,JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime)
member.summary: Creates a property that accumulates the project error status from the project's build events. A new property and new event watcher is created each time you call the method.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.GetAllBuildEvents(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession)
member.summary: Gets all of the build events for the current build session, which includes the project-related events for all of the projects and non-project build events.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.IsSuccessful(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject)
member.summary: Tells if the project had no compilation errors. Looks up its for those of the kind.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionEx.IsSuccessful(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession)
member.summary: Tells if the session had no compilation errors. Looks up its and of all of the projects for those of the kind.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject
member.summary: Represents a single project in the build process.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject.BuildEvents
member.summary: Build events for the current project (errors, warnings, console output, and status messages from the engine). The success/failure state of the project is derived from presense of any errors messages in the events.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject.BuildState
member.summary: State of the project within the current build process.

summary.para: The identity of the project, usually, a path to the project file.
You MUST NOT assume that this is the project file, or if it is a file at all.
To transition between the and the corresponding , if any, use the and functions.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProject.Name
member.summary: Gets the short name of the project.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectBuildState
member.summary: Build state for a project in the build session.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectBuildState.Excluded
member.summary: Will not be built in this session.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectBuildState.Pending
member.summary: Will be built in this session.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectBuildState.Running
member.summary: Is currently being built.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectBuildState.Completed
member.summary: Has been built (or skipped due to being up-to-date, see error status).

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectErrorStatus
member.summary: Whether the project has errors, warnings, etc, or not.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectErrorStatus.Clean
member.summary: No errors, no warnings.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectErrorStatus.Warnings
member.summary: The project has some warnings (but no errors).

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionProjectErrorStatus.Errors
member.summary: The project has some errors (maybe also warnings).

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget
member.summary: How severe should the rebuild be.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget.Clean
member.summary: All of the projects should be cleaned up.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget.Rebuild
member.summary: All of the projects should be rebuilt (cleaned up and built).

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget.Build
member.summary: Only those project whose inputs were modified in respect to their outputs should be built. This represents the classical build algorithm.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionState
member.summary: Possible build session states.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionState.Waiting
member.summary: The session has just been created and is waiting for someone to run its build (which is not guaranteed to happen).

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionState.Running
member.summary: The build is currently running.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionState.Completed
member.summary: The build has completed, either successfully or with errors. is 1.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilderObsolete
member.summary: The base interface for manipulating a solution builder.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilderObsolete.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the , does nothing if not running.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilderObsolete.BeginRun(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSession)
member.summary: Begins running a build of the session (from ), async. It's an error to invoke this method when is present.
member.param: The session to run the build of. Must not be used yet.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilderObsolete.CreateSession(JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.BuildSessionTarget,JetBrains.ProjectModel.IProject[])
member.summary: Creates a new build session.
member.param: How to build the projects.
The projects that must be included in the build (others might be included as needed), or an empty array to build the whole solution.
member.returns: The new session on which the build could be started and the progress could be tracked.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilderObsolete.RunningSession
member.summary: Gets the build session being currently run by the solution builder. Null if idle.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.CurrentSolutionBuilderObsolete.GetProjectFullPath(JetBrains.ProjectModel.IProject)
member.summary: Gets the SolBuilder-suitable full path identity of the project. Preferrably, the project file; otherwise, the project folder.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.CurrentSolutionBuilderObsolete.InitImplementations(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime)
member.summary: List of impls => active. Active impls coming and going.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.CurrentSolutionBuilderObsolete.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the , does nothing if not running.

member.summary: Begins running a build of the session (from ), async. It's an error to invoke this method when is present.
member.param: The session to run the build of. Must not be used yet.

member.summary: Creates a new build session.

The projects that must be included in the build (others might be included as needed), or an empty array to build the whole solution.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilder.IsDefault
member.summary: Delegates to VS solution builder.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.ISolutionBuilder.IsIncremental
member.summary: Has heuristics and tracks for project changes.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.None
member.summary: No information about previous build.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.HasRunningParent
member.summary: One of project parents are being built now.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.Skipped
member.summary: Project should be built because of file changes or heuristics.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.Running
member.summary: Project is being built now.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.SuccessfulWithoutWarnings
member.summary: Project was succesfully built without errors and warnings.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.SuccessfulWithWarnings
member.summary: Project was built without errors but with warnings.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.Failed
member.summary: Project building failed with errors.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectBuildingState.Cleaned
member.summary: Project was cleaned.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.None
member.summary: No information. Equals to Dirty. Should be built.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.White
member.summary: Clean. Project doesn't have any changes and doesn't have dirty parent. Should not be built.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.Black
member.summary: Dirty. Project has changes. Should be built.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.Gray
member.summary: Project doesn't have any changes, but has at least one parent(it's not necessarily - parent is direct or not) should be built. Decision(to build or not to build) will be made after building parents.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.GrayToSkip
member.summary: Project had state Gray before, but after building parents we decide to SKIP building because of heuristics.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.GrayToBuild
member.summary: Project had state Gray before, but after building parents we decide to BUILD building because of heuristics.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.NeverBuild
member.summary: Project had state Gray, but this project marked as "NeverBuild".

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.AlwaysBuild
member.summary: Project had state Gray, but this project marked as "AlwaysBuild".

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.OnlyInderectReferencesChanged
member.summary: Project was White but some of inderect references were changed. Analyzing surface could affect only first-level dependencies. This state could be used for executing

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectChangingState.BuildIsDisabled
member.summary: Build is disabled in current solution configuration+platform.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.Prototype.ProjectState.IncludedBySelection
member.summary: If user build selected project/projects, than some projects could be skipped for building. If use build all, all projects have IncludedBySelection = true. default == true

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEvent
member.summary: A build event that occured while building of the project.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventImportance
member.summary: The importance of a build event. Originates from the MSBuild importance enum. Linear order: the lower the value, the more important is the event.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind
member.summary: Kinds of events logged when building projects or the session itself.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind.Output
member.summary: Messages logged with MSBuild logger. These do not include console output (eg from external tools). Could be of various importance.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind.Service
member.summary: Service messages from the engine: projects, targets, tasks. Usually have low importance.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind.Console
member.summary: Raw console output (StdOut stream) of the MSBuild process. Any fatal failures with running the MSBuild process would also go here.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind.Warning
member.summary: A warning logged with MSBuild logger. MSBuild tasks also would usually capture cmdline tool console output that qualifies against the warning pattern and report to the logger.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.SolutionBuilders.SolBuildEventKind.Error
member.summary: A warning logged with MSBuild logger. MSBuild tasks also would usually capture cmdline tool console output that qualifies against the warning pattern and report to the logger.

member.summary: build wasn't started.

member.name: T:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation

summary.para: Helps with publishing result lists from UI components.
To be used in viewmodels. Bind to the view with a behavior for getting focus and keyboard events.

member.remarks: Behavior: See for possible states of publishing the result list. Initially, when the control is created, we'd publish the result list and keep it even on focus loss. After that, we'd publish our result list on any focus entry, but it would be revoked automatically on focus loss if there were no explicit user actions on items (like using the result list next/prev actions, or executing a node with Enter). But if there were, it's the same way as on control creation once again, until smb else pushes us out. This behavior seems to be the most friendly in terms of the implicit modality.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ResultListByOwner
member.summary: The original result list, as provided by the owner of this object. This is NOT submitted to the .

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ResultListWrapped
member.summary: The wrapped result list created by this object which reports when an action is executed, so that to switch to when it happens.

member.name: M:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ToString
member.summary: String representation, for diagnostic needs.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.IsKeyboardFocusWithin
member.summary: For binding from UI. Tells when actual keyboard focus is within the control. Controls the state. Unguarded, as this is for binding from UI.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.ItemExecuted
member.summary: For binding from viewmodel / UI. Fire this event when an item has been executed in the control. This means we should enter the state. Unguarded, as this is for binding from UI.

member.name: P:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.State
member.summary: The current state. Reflected into the global result list.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.NotPublished
member.summary: The result list is currently not published. Entry: (1) when someone else publishes a result list and pushes out our one, (2) when losing focus in state. Leave: on any entry event for other states.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.FocusPublished
member.summary: The result list has been published for the time while we have keyboard focus. Entry: control got focus ( going high) while in state. Leave: (1) control lost focus, (2) switched to due to an explicit user action.

member.name: F:JetBrains.IDE.ResultList.UIResultListPublisherAutomation.PublishingState.HardPublished
member.summary: The result list has been explicitly published, and should persist even when focus goes to another control (e.g. to text control when navigating to the next location). Entry: (1) control with a result list initially created, (2) an explicit user action, like executing result list actions in mode, or executing an item in the control with mouse or keyboard. Leave: someone has published another result list and pushed ours out.
